identity.name: RemoteDesk Pro
identity.vibe: The cockpit of a stealth jet. Not a toy. A tool for professionals.

headings.usage: Landing page headers, Dashboard section titles

mono.usage: IP addresses, Device IDs, Logs, Terminal outputs

primary.description: Stark contrast. No soft grays for primary actions.

background.description: Zinc-950 for dark mode. Not pure black, but close.

accent.name: Acid Lime
accent.usage: Primary CTAs, Active Status indicators, 'Online' badges. CUTS through the dark.

landing_page.alignment: Asymmetrical. Do not center text blocks. Align left with massive negative space on right.

buttons.style: Sharp edges (rounded-sm or rounded-none). Uppercase label. Tracking-widest.
buttons.hover: Invert colors. Black bg -> Acid Lime bg.

cards.style: Flat. 1px border. No shadow in dark mode. Subtle shadow-sm in light mode.

inputs.style: Underlined only OR solid background (zinc-900) with no border until focus.

visual_enhancers.textures: Add subtle noise overlay (opacity 0.03) to the dark background to prevent banding and add tactility.
visual_enhancers.tracing_beam: Use on the 'Active Session' card. A glowing lime line moving around the border.
visual_enhancers.glassmorphism: Use ONLY for the floating 'Remote Control Toolbar' overlay during a session. Backdrop-blur-xl, border-white/10.

media.icons: Phosphor Icons (Regular weight for UI, Duotone for Empty States)

motion.hover_effects: Instant color swap (duration-100). No sluggish fades.
motion.scroll: Lenis smooth scroll is MANDATORY for the landing page.

accessibility.contrast: Ensure Acid Lime text is ONLY used on Black backgrounds. Never on White.
accessibility.reduced_motion: Disable parallax and tracing beams if requested.

universal_guidelines: Do not use gradients for text.
Do not center-align the main dashboard container.
instructions_to_main_agent: You are building a tool for pros. It should feel fast, dangerous, and precise. Avoid 'friendly' rounded corners (use rounded-md max). Use the Acid Lime accent sparingly but effectively to guide the eye to the most important action (e.g., 'Connect'). The Dashboard is a HUD, not a blog.
